str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: (properly: I lead one as my prisoner in a triumphal procession, hence) I lead around, make a show (spectacle) of, cause to triumph.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A smell, odor, savor. From ozo; fragrance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
